physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Significant abdominal pain and signs of peritoneal irritation developed.
Pathological examination indicated transmural infarction and marked thickening of the mesenteric artery due to hyperplasia.
Digital subtraction angiography showed a 'chain of beads' appearance in a branch of the superior mesenteric artery.
Patient was asymptomatic eighteen months after operation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement noted as patient became asymptomatic.
